info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 15 at 5:48PM MDT until July 15 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico...
* Until 700 PM MDT.
* At 544 PM MDT, blowing dust was seen on web cams approaching Lordsburg Playa. Radar showed several showers were beginning to pop up in the region as well. Downbursts from these showers kick up more dust from other directions.
an area of blowing dust was over Cotton City.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 17. Portions of State Highways 9, 80, 145, and 338.
Locations impacted include... Cotton City, Steins, Rodeo, Animas, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, Granite Gap, and Pyramid Mountains.
info.instruction: Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
